New Records: Suryakumar Yadav and Virat Kohli accumulated 78 runs in the final five overs - which is India's third-highest runs in the death overs in T20Is
Virat Kohli notched up his 31st T20I fifty to equal Rohit's record for most half-centuries in the shortest format of international cricket
Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav's blitzkrieg knock of unbeaten 26-ball 68
Virat Kohli's 59 off 44 balls powered India to 192/2 in their 20 overs
Arshdeep Singh picked the wicket of opener Yasim Murtaza for run-a-ball nine
Babar Hayat and skipper Nizakat Khan forged a 39-run partnership for the second wicket
Ravindra Jadeja bagged his important wicket
Pre-Game Insights: India were put into bat after Hong Kong captain Nizakat Khan won the toss and opted to bowl first
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav was adjudged the Player of the Match for his match-winning knock
Miscellaneous Highlights: India became the second team after Afghanistan to qualify for the Super 4 stage of the Asia Cup 2022
The match was played at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium on Wednesday, August 31
